results.overview:
At Bay Ridge Elementary School for the RTS we believe that an ARTS based education program will develop students who are Active learners, Responsible citizens, Team players and Self confident young men and women.

The mission of the Bay Ridge Elementary School for the Arts is to develop the academic, social and civic skills of our students in an atmosphere that fosters independent thinking and learning.  With a highly effective partnership between the school, community and home, our students will achieve high standard of excellence.

results.overview:
PS 270: The Dekalb School is a District 13 public elementary school in the arts-rich neighborhood of Clinton Hill. We are a vibrant, growing school community, featuring a play-based early childhood program and a rigorous, interdisciplinary project-based curriculum for Kindergarten through 5th Grade through our partnership with NYC Outward Bound, Edible Schoolyard and Pratt Institute. 

PS 270's program is centered around the following components: 
-Small Group Instruction in literacy and math to target students' needs using research-based programs 
-An interdisciplinary, project-based curriculum that connects literacy instruction, culturally-relevant topics and community partnerships. 
-Field Trips & School Visits with partner organizations and institutions including Pratt Institute, Artshack Brooklyn, and City Growers/Brooklyn Grange
-Emphasis on Social Emotional Learning through Crew Morning Meetings and reinforcement of our Crew Values of Community, Advocacy, Curiosity, Creativity and Joy.
-Strong Commitment to Arts & Outdoor Education through classes, curriculum connections, and partner organizations like NYC Outward Bound.
-Community-oriented Events to bring families and staff together, like monthly community meetings, Crew gatherings and weekend community events. 
-After School Programming on site for 3k-5th grade that includes SEL, outdoor play, tutoring, sports and arts enrichment.

results.overview:
P.S. 276 is an elementary school located in District 18. We serve students in grades 3K-5. We promote college and career readiness, beginning with our early childhood learners.

At P.S. 276, we strive to instill the components of S.O.A.R within our community. We believe that every student is capable of being Strong, Outstanding, Aspiring and Resilient. 

We are a community school, which enables us to partner with a variety of organizations to expose students to different academic and social emotional outlets.

We are committed to students reading on or above grade level and ensuring the academic excellence of every student at P.S. 276.

results.overview:
PS 282 is an NYC DOE District 13 International Baccalaureate candidate school serving 3-K to 5th Grades in Park Slope, Brooklyn.

Our mission is to spark a hunger for learning in every child. 

At PS 282, we are dedicated to engaging students, staff, parents, and the community in providing rich, project-based learning experiences that support our students' social and emotional development. We foster meaningful relationships within our school community and set high expectations for all, ensuring our students dream, believe, excel and achieve their goals.

We prioritize the cognitive, emotional, and physical development of our young learners to bridge the achievement and opportunity gaps. By working together as a team and leveraging our collective skills and resources, we unlock the full potential of every student at PS 282. No additional priority is given to zoned students for the Gifted & Talented program at this school. The Autism Horizon Program supports students with autism in a special class with eight students, a special education teacher and paraprofessional with emphasis on building skills and offering opportunities for meaningful inclusion in larger settings. Students in this program may need additional academic support and require speech and language services, including in areas of social or pragmatic communication. For more information, speak with your CSE or IEP team and refer to Specialized Programs for Students with Disabilities (nyc.gov).
